# Customize which rules to include/exclude during DAST scanning

column3: # X-Content-Type-Options - may not be relevant for API endpoints
# Information Disclosure - Suspicious Comments - acceptable for development
# Information Disclosure - Suspicious Comments - review needed
# Server Leaks Information via "X-Powered-By" Header - security risk
# Secure Pages Include Mixed Content - critical
# User Controllable JavaScript Event - XSS risk
# Source Code Disclosure - critical security issue
# Retrieved from Cache - potential info disclosure
# Cookie No HttpOnly Flag - session security
# CSP Scanner - content security policy issues
# X-Debug-Token Information Leak - debug info in production
# Username Hash Found - potential info disclosure
# Feature Policy Header Not Set - security header missing
# Backup File Disclosure - critical file exposure
# Timestamp Disclosure - Unix timestamps in response
# User Agent Fuzzer - unusual user agents
# Weak Authentication Method - basic auth over HTTP
# Dangerous JS Functions - eval, setTimeout with string
# Cross Site Scripting (Persistent) - XSS in JSON
# Cross Site Scripting (DOM Based) - DOM XSS
# Insecure JSF ViewState - Java Server Faces
# Remote OS Command Injection - command execution
# XML External Entity Attack - XXE vulnerability
# SOAP Action Spoofing - web service attack
# Insecure HTTP Method - dangerous HTTP methods
# SOAP XML Injection - SOAP service injection
# WSDL File Passive Scanner - service discovery
